Type.Name: ByteOrder

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ByteOrder extends System.Enum

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A set of values describing the possible byte-orders for storing pixel values in memory.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.ByteOrder LsbFirst = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The values are stored with the least-significant byte first.
Docs.remarks: For instance, the 32-bit value 0xffeecc would be stored in memory as 0xcc, 0xee, 0xff, 0x00.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Gdk.ByteOrder MsbFirst = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The values are stored with the most-significant byte first.
Docs.remarks: For instance, the 32-bit value 0xffeecc would be stored in memory as 0x00, 0xcc, 0xee, 0xff.
